title: 108_hr904
content: United States Life-Saving Service Heritage Act - Directs the Secretary of the Interior, through the National Maritime Initiative of the National Park Service, to establish a program to inventory, evaluate, document, and assist efforts to preserve surviving US Life-Saving Service stations. Requires the Secretary to: (1) serve as a clearinghouse of information for persons interested in restoring and preserving historic lifesaving stations. (2) make information regarding the Service and related organizations that provided humanitarian assistance to shipwrecked mariners available to the public, and (3) make grants to coordinate and assist such preservation.
